title: How to Draw Kenny from South Park

steps.headline: Draw a large circle for his head.
Add the opening and drawstring of the hood.
steps.description:
Within the large circle, draw a medium size circle, then a smaller one in that one. Make sure that the top of the smaller circle touches the inside top of the medium circle. Add a leaf shape in the middle of the smaller circle. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/70\/Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Create his eyes by draw two tilted, small ovals on either side of that leaf shape.
steps.description:
Make sure they are angled inward. In the middle of each, draw a black dot for his pupil. At the bottom of the leaf shape, draw two small lines. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6a\/Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/6a\/Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Draw a medium size square below the large circle.
steps.description:
It should overlap somewhat at the top. This will be his body. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5b\/Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5b\/Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: For his feet, add two tilted, small ovals on either side of the bottom of the square.
steps.description:
They should be angled outward. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bb\/Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} To create his zipper, draw an upside down 'T' in between the two ovals.

steps.headline: On either side of the square, draw two small, curved cylinders, which should overlap the large circle slightly.
steps.description:
At the bottom of each, draw a small circle, then a smaller circle within each. The left hand should be positioned top right side, and vice versa for the right hand. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b6\/Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/b6\/Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Outline your sketch and don't forget to erase the sketch afterwards.
Color in your drawing, using mostly orange, brown and black colors.
Draw a circle for this head.
Draw another rounded lines for the hood.
Draw another two vertical curves for the depth of his hood.
Draw two ovals for the eyes.
Remove the overlap lines for the eyes.
Draw two big circles overlap by another two small circles for his hands.
Erase the overlap lines for the hands then draw two vertical lines for the pants and one thick line for his shoes.

text:
Sitting Kenny Draw a large circle for his head. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/c/c3/Draw-Kenny-Base-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/c/c3/Draw-Kenny-Base-Step-1.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Base-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add the opening and drawstring of the hood. Within the large circle, draw a medium size circle, then a smaller one in that one. Make sure that the top of the smaller circle touches the inside top of the medium circle. Add a leaf shape in the middle of the smaller circle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/7/70/Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/70/Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create his eyes by draw two tilted, small ovals on either side of that leaf shape. Make sure they are angled inward. In the middle of each, draw a black dot for his pupil. At the bottom of the leaf shape, draw two small lines. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/6/6a/Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/6/6a/Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Draw a medium size square below the large circle. It should overlap somewhat at the top. This will be his body. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/5/5b/Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/5/5b/Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} For his feet, add two tilted, small ovals on either side of the bottom of the square. They should be angled outward. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/bb/Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/bb/Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} To create his zipper, draw an upside down 'T' in between the two ovals. On either side of the square, draw two small, curved cylinders, which should overlap the large circle slightly. At the bottom of each, draw a small circle, then a smaller circle within each. The left hand should be positioned top right side, and vice versa for the right hand. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/b/b6/Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/b/b6/Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Outline your sketch and don't forget to erase the sketch afterwards. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/0f/Draw-Kenny-Outline-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/0f/Draw-Kenny-Outline-Step-7.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Outline-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Color in your drawing, using mostly orange, brown and black colors. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/e/ea/Draw-Kenny-Colour-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/ea/Draw-Kenny-Colour-Step-8.jpg/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Colour-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Standing Kenny Draw a circle for this head. Draw another rounded lines for the hood. Draw another two vertical curves for the depth of his hood. Draw two ovals for the eyes. Remove the overlap lines for the eyes. Then create his body. Draw two big circles overlap by another two small circles for his hands. Erase the overlap lines for the hands then draw two vertical lines for the pants and one thick line for his shoes. Add details. Kenny is now complete. Good job!
sentences: Sitting Kenny Draw a large circle for his head.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c3\/Draw-Kenny-Base-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/c\/c3\/Draw-Kenny-Base-Step-1.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Base-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add the opening and drawstring of the hood.
Within the large circle, draw a medium size circle, then a smaller one in that one.
Make sure that the top of the smaller circle touches the inside top of the medium circle.
Add a leaf shape in the middle of the smaller circle.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/70\/Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Hood-Opening-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Create his eyes by draw two tilted, small ovals on either side of that leaf shape.
Make sure they are angled inward.
In the middle of each, draw a black dot for his pupil.
At the bottom of the leaf shape, draw two small lines.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/6\/6a\/Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/6a\/Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Eyes-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Draw a medium size square below the large circle.
It should overlap somewhat at the top.
This will be his body.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5b\/Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/5\/5b\/Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Body-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} For his feet, add two tilted, small ovals on either side of the bottom of the square.
They should be angled outward.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/bb\/Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Feet-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} To create his zipper, draw an upside down 'T' in between the two ovals.
On either side of the square, draw two small, curved cylinders, which should overlap the large circle slightly.
At the bottom of each, draw a small circle, then a smaller circle within each.
The left hand should be positioned top right side, and vice versa for the right hand.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b6\/Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/b\/b6\/Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Arms-Step-6.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Outline your sketch and don't forget to erase the sketch afterwards.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0f\/Draw-Kenny-Outline-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/0f\/Draw-Kenny-Outline-Step-7.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Outline-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Color in your drawing, using mostly orange, brown and black colors.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/ea\/Draw-Kenny-Colour-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/ea\/Draw-Kenny-Colour-Step-8.jpg\/v4-160px-Draw-Kenny-Colour-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":610,"bigWidth":"160","bigHeight":"212","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Standing Kenny Draw a circle for this head.
Draw another rounded lines for the hood.
Draw another two vertical curves for the depth of his hood.
Draw two ovals for the eyes.
Remove the overlap lines for the eyes.
Then create his body.
Draw two big circles overlap by another two small circles for his hands.
Erase the overlap lines for the hands then draw two vertical lines for the pants and one thick line for his shoes.
Add details.
Kenny is now complete.
Good job!
